title: AI Learning Tool
intro: In this project we are createing a tool that uses AI to assist teachers in providing personalized education for students. The essence of the tool is to streamline the adaptation of texts, making the process more efficient and less time-consuming. By allowing teachers to input original texts, the tool ensures quality while offering functionalities like image scanning and automated glossary generation to enhance user experience.
description: In this project we are createing a tool that uses AI to assist teachers in providing personalized education for students. The essence of the tool is to streamline the adaptation of texts, making the process more efficient and less time-consuming. By allowing teachers to input original texts, the tool ensures quality while offering functionalities like image scanning and automated glossary generation to enhance user experience.
alt: Mockup of the website for the AI learning tool

detailed.alt: Mockup of the website. The image shows the output of the AI tool, with the text in a rich text editor.

detailed.p: Last summer, I had an idea to build a learning tool with AI that could make studying more efficient for students. I was joined by a fellow student on this project, and together we have continued to develop this tool over the past year. The tool has evolved from assisting students to focusing on making teachers' daily lives more efficient by automating the personalization of texts for individual students.
detailed.alt: Image of a pitch competition we won. The image shows the two of us holding a diploma.

detailed.p: Throughout the project, we have been involved in business development, worked towards engaging stakeholders, participated in and won pitch competitions, and developed research that resulted in two (soon to be published) conference papersâ€”one as the main author and the other as a co-author.
We are countuing the work on this proect, and are currently working on improving the efficiency of the tool. We are also working on introducing more tools to our website.

intro: This project was the exam in our 4th semester course: Full-stack webutvikling (Full-stack web development). We were 3 people in our group, and we all had different roles in the project. Initially I was responsible for the backend, but as the project progressed I also took on the role of frontend developer.
title: NTNU Ping Pong League
description: In this project the goal was to create a fully functional online table tennis league. Some of the things we implemented in this project were: "multiplayer" scoring registration through socket, refresh tokens, web components, admin page, email verification and documentation through swagger and storybook.
alt: Mockup of the ping pong league site

detailed.p: In this project the goal was to create a fully functional online table tennis league. Some of the things we implemented in this project were: "multiplayer" scoring registration through socket, refresh tokens, web components, admin page, email verification and documentation through swagger and storybook.

detailed.alt: Mockup of the ping pong league showing a match through socket.io

title: 13-segment display
d_intro: During the summer of 2023 I wanted to find a fun and different project to work on. An interesting video popped up on my youtube feed, showing examples of all kinds of different segment displays. I was imidiatley inspired to create my own version of a segment display, and I chose the 13-segment display as I could use it to display text as well as numbers.
deschtml: In this project I wanted to create a 13-segmentet display, after being inspired by a youtube video. I created this segment display as a web component, and focused on making it highly customizable. The colours and size can be altered either from the HTML or through CSS. The segment display can also be used to print out a custom text instead of this customizeable clock.

detailed.p: The previous semester we were introduced to web components, and I wanted to create a project that utilized this. The segment display is highly customizable, and the colours and size can be altered either from the HTML or thorugh CSS. The segment display can also be used to print out a custom text instead of this customizeable clock.

In the future I want to make it more accessible by adding ARIA attributes. I also want to make the segment display be compatible with more characters, and not just the ones that are currently supported. I also want to improve the clock, and make it available in more languages and date formats. Lastly I want to make the segment display more responsive, and make it look good on all screen sizes.

title: The 100 prisoners problem
description: The "100 prisoners problem" is a thought experiment in probability theory and combinatorics. In this problem, 100 numbered prisoners must find their own number in one of 100 boxes to survive. Each box contains a unique number, and each prisoner can open up to 50 boxes. The challenge is for all prisoners to find their numbers within their allowed attempts. To visualize this problem, I created a web application that simulates the prisoners' attempts to find their numbers.
alt: Illustration of a prisoner entering the room with the boxes

title: NTNU CapMap
intro: This was a part of the 5th semester course: Tingenes web (Web of things). Through CapMap we wanted to create a system that utilized ultrasonic sensors to predict how crowded different rooms at school were. This way students could easily find a place to study, and the school could optimize the use of their space. In this project we were 2 web developers and 3 interaction designers. I was responsible for the backend, while the other web developer was responsible for the frontend and the sensors.
description: Through CapMap we wanted to create a system that utilized ultrasonic sensors to predict how crowded different rooms at school were. This way students could easily find a place to study, and the school could optimize the use of their space.
alt: Mockup of the ping pong league site

detailed.p: In this project I got to with many new technologies for the first time, such as Redis, MQTT and SSE (Server Sent Events). It was also inspireing to be able to work with a physical product that we could interact with through the website.

title: CSS art
intro: In this project the goal was to recreate an image through CSS only. This was apart of the course Advanced CSS that we had in our second semester.
description: In this project the goal was to recreate an image through CSS only. This was apart of the course Advanced CSS that we had in our second semester.
